intro: Scabiosa columbaria subsp. lucida, commonly known as the shining scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Scabiosa columbaria subsp. lucida is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
